overview: From 2026-02-02 to 2026-02-03, elizaos-plugins/plugin-n8n-workflow had 2 new PRs (3 merged), 0 new issues, and 2 active contributors.

topPRs.title: fix: workflow actions reliability + credential injection + cloud integration
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
## Summary
- **Fix credential injection**: fuzzy Api suffix matching in credentialResolver + correct LLM prompt examples (`gmailOAuth2Api` → `gmailOAuth2`)
- **Fix intent classification**: language-agnostic structural rules instead of keyword-based matching — short confirmations like "creer le" no longer misclassify as "new"
- **Fix DELETE/ACTIVATE/DEACTIVATE**: fetch workflows directly from service instead of relying on `state.data.workflows` (provider data not reliably merged into state by ElizaOS)
- **Fix settings access**: use `runtime.character.settings.workflows` instead of `runtime.getSetting()` which only returns primitives
- **Auto-activate workflows** after deployment via `POST /workflows/{id}/activate`
- **Remove LIST_N8N_WORKFLOWS action**: `activeWorkflowsProvider` already injects workflow list into LLM context (bootstrap plugin pattern)
- **Add safety net** in CREATE "new" path: restore draft if generation fails
- **Rename settings key** from `n8n` to `workflows`
- **Update node catalog** via new `crawl-nodes` script
- **Cloud bridge credential_data flow**: plugin creates n8n credentials from OAuth tokens/API keys provided by cloud bridge, caches mapping in credential store
- **Integration availability check** (spec 09): three-tier pre-generation check — immediate block when no service nodes remain, LLM feasibility assessment when partial coverage exists, proceed when all integrations are available. Prevents generating workflows the platform can't run
- **Conversation context preservation**: `buildConversationContext` passes last 5 messages to generation, preventing context loss after errors or multi-turn interactions
- **Constrain generation to catalog**: LLM prompt now enforces strict usage of provided node types only

## Test plan
- [x] 159 tests pass (unit, integration, E2E)
- [ ] Live test: create workflow → verify credentials injected + auto-activated
- [ ] Live test: delete workflow by ID or name
- [ ] Live test: confirm short messages ("go", "oui") classify as confirm, not new
- [ ] Live test: create workflow with unsupported integrations → UNSUPPORTED_INTEGRATION response
- [ ] Live test: create workflow with partially supported integrations → feasibility check proceeds or blocks
- [ ] Live test: confirm draft with missing credentials → AUTH_REQUIRED with auth URLs

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

## Release Notes

* **New Features**
  * Workflow modification: modify existing drafts without full regeneration
  * Execution history: view workflow run history and status details
  * Enhanced credential handling: automatic detection and authentication flow for missing credentials
  * Improved workflow matching: identify workflows by name or semantic description

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Draft lifecycle management and recovery after generation failures
  * Credential resolution priority and caching
  * Workflow matching accuracy

* **Documentation**
  * Comprehensive architecture and specification guide
  * Updated prompts for better intent classification supporting multiple languages

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: fix(ci): add crawl-nodes to publish workflow + bump to 1.0.9
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
## Summary
- Add missing `bun run crawl-nodes` step to publish workflow (npm-deploy.yml) before build
- Bump version to 1.0.9 (v1.0.8 tag already exists from failed publish)

The CI workflow (ci.yml) already had this step in all jobs, but the publish workflow was missing it, causing the build to fail on `src/data/defaultNodes.json` import.

topPRs.title: chore: bump version to 1.0.8
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
## Summary
- Bump package version from 1.0.7 to 1.0.8 after merging PR #8 (integration availability check + reliability fixes)
